description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1u1j","text":"This protocol assumes that your MinION run has been completed and the data from the run has been saved. It should take you from raw data to usable FASTA files containing consensus sequences for each of your fungal barcodes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8knkl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h3bb","text":"Note: This protocol assumes you are using 10.4.1 flowcells with V14 chemistry, so there is a process to filter out and combine your duplex reads with your simplex reads. It will also show the average quality scores from each simplex and duplex component.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"331il","text":"This protocol assumes the experiment name is \"FirstRun.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b5f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2tbpk","text":"Create a new working folder on the desktop. Ex - FirstRun. Within that create a new folder called \"fast5,\" another called \"Programs,\" and a final one called \"NGSpeciesID.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"38t4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4tntj","text":"I will start by copying all of the fast5 files from:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"840aa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm1k3","text":"/var/lib/minknow/data/./FirstRun/CellName/long_unique_name/fast5 to the newly created fast5 folder on the desktop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2dgvs","text":"Create an index file from your extraction template papers. This will allow you to link all of your reads with the individual specimens. A template for 10 plates (960 specimens) can be found here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1j27d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkh6r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c483t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bj512","text":"This .xlsx is formatted to utilize the Lab Code and iNaturalist # columns as the only inputs. It will combine these and all of the other columns into a single cell - concatenating them all into the final file name. For the Lab Code, I will typically put these into the iNaturalist \"Voucher Number(s)\" Observational Field, and then export them all at once into a .csv from iNat. This allows me to simply copy and paste many iNat numbers at once, without ever needing to input any of the numbers manually.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35mct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bi12g","text":"After editing, save as a tab-delimited text file in the NGSpeciesID folder. You will need to remove most of the final columns from the template. The final output should be saved like this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7uibb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8jpek","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ameqf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"95CF2A0049BA11EDB22797B90B704B14","id":303063,"original_name":"NANOPORE TEMPLATE SEVENTH RUN.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/jh8zbtupp.xlsx"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"A67084D049BA11EDB22797B90B704B14","id":303064,"original_name":"Index.txt","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/jh82btupp.txt"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7r6a","text":"This command will install the duplex tools you will need for filtering them out and combining them with the simplex reads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bc70k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eos21","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"41chs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"enu1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ff7l1","text":"python -m venv venv --prompt duplex","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"20qq0","text":". venv/bin/activate","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9av5p","text":"pip install duplex_tools","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7r07","text":"Around 20-30% of the reads in your final results will be duplex reads - the single fragment is read twice - once in the forward direction and one in the reverse direction. These reads need to be identified with the command below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eoafe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9nsju","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ddvg9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"38tih","text":"duplex_tools pairs_from_summary ~/Desktop/FirstRun/simplex_calls/sequencing_summary.txt ~/Desktop/FirstRun/simplex_calls/pairs","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fpj9","text":"duplex_tools filter_pairs ~/Desktop/FirstRun/simplex_calls/pairs/pair_ids.txt ~/Desktop/FirstRun/simplex_calls/pass","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhthb","text":"Utilize NGSpecies ID to generate your final consensus sequences from your demultiplexed samples. This can take  . It would be great if someone could get this to run through the GPU.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7trqf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f32c4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fk2uo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":28800,"guid":"D6F3FF00C10711ED8CD8C1BB126195C2","id":"82803","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ac1kh","text":"conda activate NGSpeciesID","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bgc2m","text":"for file in *.fastq; do","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"68pnq","text":"bn=`basename $file .fastq`","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3sme9","text":"NGSpeciesID --ont --consensus --sample_size 500 --m 730 --s 400 --medaka --primer_file primers.txt --fastq $file --outfolder ${bn}","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7l03","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
